name: Formosan Jewel Orchid
description: Anoectochilus formosanus, commonly known as Formosan Jewel Orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to tropical regions of Taiwan (Formosa). It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and features creeping stems (15-30 cm long) with small, dramatic, oval-shaped, dark green leaves with distinctive intricate vein patterns that resemble precious metalwork. The plant displays a creeping growth habit. Orchids have highly specialized flowers designed for specific pollinators. Adapted to tropical climates with high humidity, consistent warmth, and filtered light conditions. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds vibrant colors and visual interest to any environment. It's popular among orchid enthusiasts for its attractive veined foliage.
careTips: Water when media begins to dry
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
Feed with orchid fertilizer during growing season
